FuncDef: This command discovers and displays the hop-by-hop path for a source-to-leaf (S2L) sub-LSP of an RSVP P2MP LSP.
CLIs: p2mp-lsp-trace <lsp-name> p2mp-instance <instance-name> s2l-dest-address <ip-address> [ fc <fc-name> [ profile { in | out } ] ] [ size <octets> ] [ max-fail <no-response-count> ] [ probe-count <probes-per-hop> ] [ min-ttl <min-label-ttl> ] [ max-ttl <max-label-ttl> ] [ timeout <timeout> ] [ interval <interval> ] [ detail ]

ParaDef.Info: The fc and profile parameters are used to indicate the forwarding class and profile of the MPLS echo request packet. Values-be, l2, af, l1, h2, ef, h1, nc. ParamDefault: Default- be

The interval parameter in seconds, expressed as a decimal integer. This parameter is used to override the default echo request message send interval and defines the minimum amount of time that must expire before the next echo request message is sent. Values-1 to 10. ParamDefault: Default- 1
Name that identifies an P2MP LSP, to 32 characters long, to ping.

The maximum number of consecutive MPLS echo requests, expressed as a decimal integer that do not receive a reply before the trace operation fails for a given TTL. Values-1 to 255. ParamDefault: Default- 5
Specifies the maximum TTL value in the MPLS label for the LSP trace test, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 255. ParamDefault: Default- 30
Specifies the minimum TTL value in the MPLS label for the LSP trace test, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 255. ParamDefault: Default- 1
Configures the name, up to 32 characters long, of the specific instance of the P2MP LSP to send the echo request.
Specifies the number of LSP trace echo request messages to send per TTL value. Values-1 to 10. ParamDefault: Default- 1
The profile of the LSP trace echo request message. ParamDefault: Default- out
Specifies the egress LER system address of the S2L sub-LSP path which is being traced.

The size in octets, expressed as a decimal integer, of the MPLS echo request packet, including the IP header but not the label stack. The request payload is padded with zeros to the specified size. Note that an OAM command is not failed if the user entered a size lower than the minimum required to build the packet for the echo request message. The payload is automatically padded to meet the minimum size. Values-1 to 9198. ParamDefault: Default- 1

The timeout parameter in seconds, expressed as a decimal integer. This value is used to override the default timeout value and is the amount of time that the router will wait for an echo reply message from all leaves of the P2MP LSP after sending the message request message. Upon the expiration of message timeout, the requesting router assumes that the missing replies will not be received. Any echo reply message received after the request times out will be silently discarded. Values-1 to 60. ParamDefault: Default- 3
